Slides.Title: What is Object Detection?
Slides.ImageIdea: A scene with various objects like cars, people, and signs, each with a box around them.
Slides.ConceptExplanation: Object detection is about finding and identifying objects in pictures.
Slides.DeepExplanation: Imagine you have a picture of a busy street. Object detection helps a computer find and name things like cars, people, and traffic lights in that picture.
Slides.GraphIdea: A simple diagram showing input image and output with labeled boxes.
Slides.Example: Detecting cars and pedestrians in a street scene for autonomous driving.
Slides.Content: Object detection helps computers see and understand what's in a picture. It's like when you look at a photo and can point out a car, a person, or a tree. This is important for things like self-driving cars, which need to know what's around them to drive safely.

Slides.Title: Understanding Precision in Object Detection
Slides.ImageIdea: Two circles showing overlap between detected objects and actual objects.
Slides.ConceptExplanation: Precision tells us how many of the detected objects were actually correct.
Slides.DeepExplanation: Think of precision like a test score. If you answer 8 out of 10 questions correctly, your precision is 80%. In object detection, if you detect 10 objects and 8 are correct, your precision is 80%.
Slides.GraphIdea: Bar chart comparing true positives and false positives.
Slides.Example: In a test, if a model detects 10 cars and 8 are actually cars, precision is 80%.
Slides.Content: Precision is like a score that tells us how good we are at finding the right objects. If we detect 10 cars and 8 are really cars, our precision is 80%. This helps us know how accurate our object detection is.

Slides.Title: The Role of Focal Loss in Object Detection
Slides.ImageIdea: A graph showing how focal loss changes with different values of p_t.
Slides.ConceptExplanation: Focal loss helps focus on hard-to-detect objects by giving them more weight.
Slides.DeepExplanation: Imagine you're studying for a test and you focus more on the hard questions. Focal loss does the same for object detection, helping the model learn better by focusing on the tough parts.
Slides.GraphIdea: Line graph showing focal loss curve with varying gamma values.
Slides.Example: In detecting small objects like birds, focal loss helps the model pay more attention to these challenging detections.
Slides.Content: Focal loss is like a special trick that helps our model pay more attention to the hard-to-find objects. It's like when you study harder for the tough questions on a test. This makes our object detection better, especially for small or tricky objects.

Labs.Title: Lab 1: Calculating Precision and Recall
Labs.Goal: Learn how to calculate precision and recall for object detection.

Dataset.description: A small dataset with predicted and actual labels for objects in images.

CodeFiles.description: Python script to calculate precision and recall from the dataset.

Labs.Title: Lab 2: Visualizing Object Detection Results
Labs.Goal: Create visualizations to understand object detection performance.

Dataset.description: Dataset with bounding box coordinates and labels for visualization.

CodeFiles.description: Python script to plot detected objects on images.

Labs.Title: Lab 3: Exploring Focal Loss
Labs.Goal: Understand how focal loss affects model training.

Dataset.description: Dataset with predictions and true labels to explore focal loss impact.

CodeFiles.description: Python script to simulate focal loss on a dataset.

RelationToSlides: The Role of Focal Loss in Object Detection
